section.title: Ticket Number Generator Modules
section.para: Ticket number generators are used to create distinct identifiers aka TicketNumber for new tickets. Any method of creating a string of numbers is possible, you should use common sense about the length of the resulting string (guideline: 5-10). When creating a ticket number, make sure the result is prefixed by the SysConfig-Variable SystemID in order to enable the detection of ticket numbers on inbound email responses. A ticket number generator module needs the two functions TicketCreateNumber() and GetTNByString(). The method TicketCreateNumber() is called without parameters and returns the new ticket number. The method GetTNByString() is called with the param String which contains the string to be parsed for a ticket number and returns the ticket number if found.

section.title: Code example
section.para: See Kernel/System/Ticket/Number/UserRandom.pm in the package TemplateModule.

section.title: Ticket numbers should follow a specific scheme.
section.para: You will need to create a new ticket number generator if the default modules don't provide the ticket number scheme you'd like to use.

section.title: Caveats and Warnings
section.para: You should stick to the code of GetTNByString() as used in existing ticket number generators to prevent problems with ticket number parsing. Also the routine to detect a loop in TicketCreateNumber() should be kept intact to prevent duplicate ticket numbers.

section.title: Release Availability
section.para: Ticket number generators have been available in OTRS since OTRS 1.1.
